Article: Today’s agriculture routinely uses advanced technologies (robots, drones, temperature and moisture sensors, aerial images, and GPS technology) to enable precision agriculture and make farming safer, more profitable, efficient and sustainable. We already have tools and devices to sense, measure and collect data from soil, crops and livestock. Fortunately, for developers and suppliers of ag tech, there are no better customers than farmers. By the nature of their work, farmers become skilled tinkers, and they are readily progressive about embracing new high-tech tools and devices. They are fearless and enthusiastic. However, farmers are also impatient because they need results for the next harvest. We designed this Special Project to illustrate how agriculture technology is bringing fundamental changes to the food chain. In the following stories, we explore advancements in agriculture tech, while examining the new challenges that farmers face.
